awd_abstract_narration: Knowledge of molecular structure and dynamics and the ability                   to utilize and compare structural results are central to                        contemporary chemical research.   In this arena, it is                          essential that the modern chemistry department have state-of-                   the-art computational facilities in order to enhance the                        research capabilities of active faculty.                                                                                                                        This award, co-funded by the Chemistry Shared Instrumentation                   Program and the Biological Instrumentation Program, will aid in                 the acquisition of computer equipment that will upgrade                         existing computational facilities and add new capabilities in                   the Department of Chemistry at Stanford.  The areas of chemical                 research that will be enhanced by the acquisition include:                                                                                                      1) Structural Inorganic Chemistry of Metal Porphyrin Complexes                  2) Structural Studies of Bioinorganic Systems                                   3) Stucture and Dynamics of Polymer Systems                                     4) Structural Chemistry of Osmium Complexes                                     5) Calculations of Magnetic Field Effects and NMR Data Analysis                 6) Organic Synthesis and Transition Metal Catalysis                             7) Synthetic Structural Organic Chemistry
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
